intro: Fuirena leptostachya f. nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flowered fuirena, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are usually yellow or orange in color. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
